comment: Very lazy professor. Does not go beyond reading straight from slides.  Lectures are boring and non informative .Midterms and quizzes are taken straight from the slides. You can get an easy A without learning anything, I wish this class could be offered online instead of wasting students time. Attendance is mandatory but nobody shows up to class

Great professor! If you are interested to learn what you are studying for this is the best professor. He has so much passion for his job, and he is very knowledgeable. It is good to be present in his lectures because you will understand more. Attendance was not mandatory. He gives extra credits for field trips and bonus problem solving.

Lectures are so boring. Classes seem pointless because he posts everything online but he makes you come each time for attendance and class problems. Homework is graded very harshly. Quizzes ask really specific questions from lectures that seem unimportant. Test questions were stuff that wasn't in the slides. Gives extra credit for field trips.

He's not a hard teacher overall, he just expects a lot. I had him before for solid waste. For an online course, it was not hard. His homework questions and test are EXACTLY like his powerpoint questions, just different numbers. His quizzes are word for word on the powerpoint. If you have a question, he's happy to help. Just study, you'll do well.

He's not a hard teacher overall, he just expects a lot. I had him before for solid waste. For an online course, it was not hard. His homework questions and tests are EXACTLY like his powerpoint questions, just different numbers. His quizzes are word for word on the powerpoint. If you have a question, he's happy to help. Just study, you'll do well.

Professor Karim overall is a pretty tough grader. Homework grades hard,Test grades hard, quizzes expects you to remember everything and even assignments in class grades hard. Lots of material is being thrown at you. Some things he is alright with but overall he just grades really heavy.

Took him for solid waste. There is no way to prepare for the free response questions on the exams other than mastering the slides. His homework was easy, exact same problems as shown in the slides. Quizzes were also easy from the slides. He doesn't like to reply to emails. I've had Karim before so I knew what to expect. Only one who teaches this.

Taking him in lecture was a waste of time. He only teaches by reading a 100 page PowerPoint to you every week, and pulls random facts from those PowerPoints and expects you to memorize them on quizzes. He is also a very tough grader on homework's. Overall very unhappy with what I got out of this class.

took this class online in summer. didnt think the class was too hard. homework problems were similar to the examples from slides. midterm was easier than final. got a 98 on midterm 76 on final. quizzes are over the slides. he didn't reply to some emails. graded hw quick but didn't give the best feedback .i didnt watch any of his videos and was fine

reads word for word from every slide. never responds to emails. he is a fast grader though, even though he grades hard. takes off a lot of points for very small mistakes. tests are straightforward but have lengthy problems and expects no mistakes on any step. believes that envEng is THE best discipline and MOST important. can be very rude at times

Extremely hard to understand. Test are very difficult. Doesn't fully cover everything that you are tested on. I would never take this man again. Always runs over class time. The word intro, in Intro to Environmental Engineering means nothing to him. Make sure yo are up to date on Fluid Mechanics when take this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I took him online, so much material. The professor is very knowledgeable but blows through 100 powerpoint slides every lecture. Homework and quiz every 2 weeks. For the exams he would tell us how many questions and what topics each would cover, still it would be very difficult. Recommend to avoid this professor if possible. Doesnt respond to emails
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Not helpful at all. I have now created my entire college schedule around not taking him. Not only were the midterm and final averages below 70 (bc you can't come close to finishing the whole thing), he didn't round or curve in the slightest. Partial credit is pathetic. Dropped from an A to barely a C. If you can avoid him, I highly recommend it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Wish I could rate 0. His grading is incredibly harsh. You WILL wind up teaching yourself. Don't bother trying to talk to him, he just likes to argue. Tells the class how easy the final will be and its similar to the semester's work, then gives departmnt final asking things we never covered. Class avg for the final was a 56. Curved final grade 2 pts
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He just reads the slides. In a math based class, this is anything but helpful. You will wind up teaching yourself. VERY harsh grader. Gives little to NO partial credit, especially if you didn't do the problem exactly how he taught it. Please take someone else who can better explain difficult concepts.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Probably the worst professor I've ever had. Don't take him if you can avoid it. He reads the powerpoints of the book for lecture and is little to no help. If you have to take him, be prepared to teach yourself and deal with extremely challenging exams. He'll tell you that you'll pass, then fail you at the end. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Online quizzes, homework, and discussion posts are easy A's. However the tests are brutal. Study slide examples and homework problems. Also, MEMORIZE everything from the slides. Paraphrasing on the test does not get you full credit. Go to all the extra credit field trips, they help. First test average was 67, final was 51. No curve.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Karim has his own teaching skills. The way to pass the class is by memorizing everything even if you do not understand it. His grading is super hard.

The material covered in this class is not very difficult at all. He is a very tough grader. He will give you partial credit up to the point of your 1st mistake. So if you mess up a calculation in step 1 but your process is right and the calculation was your only mistake then the whole question is wrong. If you can, take someone else!

he is a nice guy, will answer your questions, and help you. But his teaching is terrible and he does not make the class clear. For tests, all i can say is MEMORIZE EVERYTHING. one problem had 10 variables you needed to memorize. final was so bad i went from a B to a D. He did help me out with a C.

he talks more about chemistry than engineering. Yeah everyone knows how to take his class, but the quality of teaching isn't there. memorize everything or you wont pass the tests. Ive learned more in environmental 2 with another teacher in the first 2 weeks than i did with him a whole semester.

Dr. Karim was an excellent professor and very knowledgeable on the subject. The lectures were interesting, but he does throw a lot of material at you. It's important to know what material to know and study b/c of that. 2 tests and 1 final are based on HW and quizzes. He tells you the topic of what each question will be. Grades hard too.

Test question are pretty specific. Grades hard. Homework and a quiz most every week, due on Sunday or Friday night. Hybrid, so rushes in lecture. Takes the class very seriously. Pay attention in class. Expects you to know chemistry from previous courses.

There is little correlation between project descriptions and what he actually grades you on. Test questions are vague at best, "design an aeration tank" could mean select dimensions, or solve for 14 associated variables pertaining to design. Meaning changes from assignment to assignment. More concerned with being right than being accurate.

Karim is a great professor. If you do the assignments while using your brain, like in other classes, you should get an A in his class. You need to participate and answer him when he asks questions. I definitely recommend him for any class he offers!
I took SoM in summer 2015. He is an excellent teacher and care about students' success. I would take him again if I get a chance.

He is an excellent teacher. I took CE 3703 in summer 2015. He assigned two projects: 1. Water Treatment Plant Design and 2. Wastewater Treatment Plant Design. He made us write professional reports with AutoACD drawings. I learned a lot from these two projects.
He Ian excellent teacher and he knows the subject matter. If your little serious you will learn a lot that can directly used in the field and get A. Field trips are great.
Excellent

Dr. Karim is a ok professor for ENGR 3131. One thing about the course though was that his assistant always graded assignments, and they would sometimes make a mistake but this was always fixed. Homework is a must, lectures are interesting and teach the import parts of the course. Tests and quiz are usually the same as homework problems or lecture.
He talks REALLY fast. REALLY. FAST.  He talks  A LOT too. But he's a great professor.

Good professor. Sometimes talks to fast but everything you need to know is in the powerpointts. Homework problems are almost identical to the lectures examples. Tests are OK but the final was wayyyyyy harder. He will explain anything you ask, just dont ask stupid questions lol.

Dr. Karim is an excellent professor and knows the material very well. .His main interest to help the students succeeded. Professor Karim explain the lecture materials very good so students be prepared for the Fundamental of Engineering exam which is very useful for future engineering careers. Exams and quizzes are very fair

I took this class in Summer 2013. He is a cool professor, explains everything very clearly. He seems to be very easy going and helpful teacher. If you study a seriously you can make A in his calss easily.

Dr Karim:I think it is a better idea to spend some time to learn basic math equations and fluid units rather than explain how to use them... and also you donâ€™t have to be mathematician to know how derivative works. The only plus about the class is the test are easy (Exact textbook examples) if you are not considering learning the material.The worst
His grading policy is not clear.  Grading is harsh and you can easily fail the class.

Learned a lot in this class. Definitely needs to work on keeping promises he made to class. For example, give ALL formulas in exams when promised to class in previous lecture. Some calculations problems are lengthy in terms of formulas it requires to solve problems, so he needs to limit them. Other than that he is a cool professor

Nice guy, but I was in his guinea pig class for Strength of Materials, and he had no idea what he was doing... and as a result, I now have no idea what I'm doing, I'll have to retake the class. His accent is thick to the point of being incomprehensible at times, and his grading rubric seems arbitrary (and not always in your favor).

Class attendance isn't mandatory but he will add a couple of point to your final grade if you go to all the classes. His grading system is fair but you can only push him so far when trying to get extra points on a test or quiz. He definitely knows the material but he sometimes focuses quizzes and tests on terminology instead of equations.
Not a very good professor. Very confusing to try to understand. Homework is a must. Hard to understand. Test's are pretty easy if you review the hw and examples from class.
Not good at getting the lesson across, and moves way too fast

Very great professor who will go every length to help his students to understand his materials. He made Engineering Statics which I feared much very easy to comprehend. You will never be disappointed if you take his class.

Fall 2011 was his first semester teaching at SPSU but was previously an instructor at other universities. He was given the course to teach just a couple of weeks before the semester started so he explained to us that he was re-learning the material. His tests were challenging and covered most of the important points in the textbook.
Amazing professor, although can be a little difficult to understand, he will clarify anything whenever you ask and goes out of his way to help when students do not understand
